Economic Collapse: Without memory, people would not be able to recall their jobs, financial transactions, or professional skills. This would lead to a collapse of the global economy as businesses and industries would be unable to function.
Social Breakdown: Without memory, people would lose their sense of identity and community, leading to a breakdown of social structures and relationships.

Increased Dependence on Technology: In the absence of memory, people would rely heavily on technology to store and recall information, leading to a further dependence on digital devices and the internet.

Global Amnesia: If everyone on Earth lost their memory at the same time, it would be a global amnesia event, which would require a massive global response to help people recover and rebuild their memories.
Memory Therapy: Governments and organizations would invest heavily in memory therapy and research to help people recover their memories and rebuild their lives.
